channel.title: Whonix KVM Security Bug Report
channel.description:
[quote="Patrick, post:17, topic:15912"] Therefore the only way forward that I can see here is: [Bug Reports, Software Development and Feature Requests chapter Generic Bug Reproduction in Whonix wiki](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Reporting_Bugs#Generic_Bug_Reproduction)
1. “forget” about Whonix 2. make KVM work without dnsmasq using Debian (stable) 3. make KVM work (using Debian (stable)) with a network configuration similar to Whonix-Gateway without dnsmasq
If you find out more, please keep us posted. Could be interesting and might be considered for future development. [/quote] While following your advice and gutting KVM, QEMU, Whonix and Debian, I found a **critical** security mal-configuration affecting Whonix KVM
This security vulnerability allows **complete** take-over of Whonix Gateway and Workstation and is able to de-anonymize users with 0 interaction, and without their knowledge
How do I report this to you privately?

item.title: Whonix KVM Security Bug Report
item.dc:creator: NotFound
item.description:
How to disable DHCP in Whonix and ensure no leaks

Therefore the only way forward that I can see here is:
Bug Reports, Software Development and Feature Requests chapter Generic Bug Reproduction in Whonix wiki

  1. “forget” about Whonix
  2. make KVM work without dnsmasq using Debian (stable)
  3. make KVM work (using Debian (stable)) with a network configuration similar to Whonix-Gateway without dnsmasq

If you find out more, please keep us posted. Could be interesting and might be considered for future development.

While following your advice and gutting KVM, QEMU, Whonix and Debian, I found a critical security mal-configuration affecting Whonix KVM

This security vulnerability allows complete take-over of Whonix Gateway and Workstation and is able to de-anonymize users with 0 interaction, and without their knowledge

How do I report this to you privately?
